definition: Tiger Leaping Gorge on the Jinsha River 金沙江[Jin1 sha1 jiang1] in Lijiang Naxi autonomous county 麗江納西族自治縣|丽江纳西族自治县[Li4 jiang1 Na4 xi1 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4], Yunnan
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
gorge

sentences.english: Tiger Leaping Gorge, we were caught in a traffic due to debris flow.
sentences.chinese: 从香格里拉到虎跳峡的路上，因泥石流出现堵车。

sentences.english: Not far from the city are the snowy Yulong Mountain and the Tiger Leaping Gorge.
sentences.chinese: 离城不远处有玉龙雪山和虎跳峡。

sentences.english: It is very different than the Tiger Leaping Gorge case.
sentences.chinese: 这跟虎跳峡的情况是很不一样的。

sentences.english: The next day, dangerous Tiger Leaping Gorge, Interview with the Tibetan family.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，险峻的虎跳峡，夜访藏家。

sentences.english: Tiger leaping gorge is the world famous grand canyon, and grotesque known to the world.
sentences.chinese: 虎跳峡是世界上著名的大峡谷，以奇险雄壮著称于世。

sentences.english: The far side of the mountain forms one side of Tiger Leaping Gorge (Hutiao Xia).
sentences.chinese: 遥远的那一边的一侧是虎跳峡。

definition: Mt Yulong or Jade dragon in Lijiang 麗江|丽江, northwest Yunnan
Meilixue or Meri snow mountains, with peaks up to 6000 m., in Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Yunnan
Lugu Lake
Mt Haba (Nakhi: golden flower), in Lijiang 麗江|丽江, northwest Yunnan

Gyeltang or Gyalthang town and county, former name of Shangri-La county 香格里拉縣|香格里拉县[Xiang1 ge2 li3 la1 xian4] in Dêqên or Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], northwest Yunnan
Lijiang old town (in Yunnan)
Lake Mibgai Co or Miga Tso, in Dartsendo or Kangding 康定[Kang1 ding4], Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture, Sichuan
Lijiang prefecture-level city in northwest Yunnan

Shangri-La (mythical location)/Shangri-La town and county in Dêqên or Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], northwest Yunnan/formerly Gyeltang or Gyalthang, Chinese 中甸[Zhong1 dian4] in Tibetan province of Kham
Dulong river in northwest Yunnan on border with Myanmar, tributary of Salween or Nujiang 怒江, sometimes referred to as number four of Three parallel rivers 三江並流|三江并流, wildlife protection unit
Nujiang river of south Tibet and northwest Yunnan, the upper reaches of Salween river 薩爾溫江|萨尔温江, forming border of Myanmar and Thailand
Baimaxue mountains, up to 5430 m., in Dechen or Diqing Tibetan autonomous prefecture 迪慶藏族自治州|迪庆藏族自治州[Di2 qing4 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Yunnan
Daocheng county (Tibetan: 'dab pa rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)
the Grand Canyon of the Nujiang river in Tibet and Yunnan
Markam county, Tibetan: Smar khams rdzong, in Chamdo prefecture 昌都地區|昌都地区[Chang1 du1 di4 qu1], Tibet
Erhai Lake
